pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:5.1: 53. The training rule on licking the bowl
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating licking their bowls. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:7.1: “‘I will not eat licking my bowl,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:8.1: One should not eat licking the bowl.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect eats licking his bowl, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:10.1: The third training rule is finished.
